DiscreteDists 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    The Discrete Generalized Burr Hatke distribution

    dDGBH.Rd

    These functions define the density, distribution function, quantile function and random generation for the Discrete Generalized Burr Hatke distribution with parameter \(\mu\).

    dDGBH(x, mu = 0.999, sigma = 100, log = FALSE)

pDGBH(q, mu = 0.999, sigma = 100, lower.tail = TRUE, log.p = FALSE)

qDGBH(p, mu = mu, sigma = sigma, lower.tail = TRUE)

rDGBH(n, mu = 0.999, sigma = 100)

    Arguments

    x, q

    vector of (non-negative integer) quantiles.

    mu

    vector of the mu parameter.

    sigma

    vector of the sigma parameter.

    log, log.p

    logical; if TRUE, probabilities p are given as log(p).

    lower.tail

    logical; if TRUE (default), probabilities are \(P[X <= x]\), otherwise, P[X > x].

    p

    vector of probabilities.

    n

    number of random values to return.

    Value

    dDGBH gives the density, pDGBH gives the distribution function, qDGBH gives the quantile function, rDGBH

    generates random deviates.

    Details

    The Discrete Burr-Hatke distribution with parameters \(\mu\) has a support 0, 1, 2, ... and density given by

    \(f(x | \mu) = (\frac{1}{x+1}-\frac{\mu}{x+2})\mu^{x}\)

    The pmf is log-convex for all values of \(0 < \mu < 1\), where \(\frac{f(x+1;\mu)}{f(x;\mu)}\) is an increasing function in \(x\) for all values of the parameter \(\mu\).

    Note: in this implementation we changed the original parameters \(\lambda\) for \(\mu\), we did it to implement this distribution within gamlss framework.

    References

    Yousof HM, Chesneau C, Hamedani G, Ibrahim M (2021). “A new discrete distribution: Properties, characterizations, modeling real count data, Bayesian and non-Bayesian estimations.” Statistica.

    See also

    DGBH.

    Author

    Sofia Cuartas García, scuartasg@unal.edu.co

    Examples

    # Example 1
dDGBH(x=0:10, mu=0.56, sigma=1.1)
#>  [1] 7.200000e-01 1.838149e-01 6.031108e-02 2.194229e-02 8.399111e-03
#>  [6] 3.306523e-03 1.323357e-03 5.349608e-04 2.175673e-04 8.879722e-05
#> [11] 3.630897e-05
